    • Method Detail

      • isDeclaring

        public final boolean isDeclaring()
        Checks if this assignment is a declaring one.
        See Also:
        declaring()

      • declaring

        public final T declaring(boolean isDeclaring)
        Defines if this assignment is a declaring one. A declaring assignment is one that first defines the value of a reference, that is a let or var assignment. An assignment to a previously defined mutable variable (one declared with var) is not a declaring assignment.

        This is a builder method.

        Parameters:
        isDeclaring - whether the assignment is declaring.
        Returns:
        this assignment

      • declaring

        public final T declaring()
        Makes this assignment a declaring one.

        Same as declaring(true).

        Returns:
        this assignment

      • variable

        public abstract T variable()
        Makes this assignment variable.
        See Also:
        LocalReference.variable()

        public final ExpressionStatement<?> expression()

      • as

        public final T as(java.lang.Object expr)
        Defines the value to be assigned.

        This is a builder method.

        Parameters:
        expr - the ExpressionStatement to assign or an object that can be converted into an expression
        Returns:
        this assignment
        See Also:
        ExpressionStatement.of(Object)

      • to

        public abstract T to(java.lang.Object... refs)
        Defines the references to which assign the expression.

        This is a builder method.

        For instance, code like: 

        
  foo = 42
        can be generated by: 
        
 assign(constant(42)).to(localRef("foo"))
        or using implicit conversions: 
        
 assign(42).to("foo")
        Parameters:
        refs - the LocalReferences to assign to
        Returns:
        this assignment

      • getDeclaringReferences

        public LocalReference[] getDeclaringReferences()
        Returns only the declaring references.
        Specified by:
        getDeclaringReferences in interface ReferencesHolder

      • replaceElement

        protected void replaceElement(GoloElement<?> original,
                              GoloElement<?> newElement)
        Replace a child.

        Replace original with newElement if original is a child of this node and type matches.

        Specified by:
        replaceElement in class GoloElement<T extends GoloAssignment<T>>
        Parameters:
        original - the original value to replace. Must be a child of this node
        newElement - the element to replace with. Type must match.
        See Also:
        GoloElement.cantReplace(), GoloElement.cantReplace(GoloElement, GoloElement), GoloElement.doesNotContain(GoloElement), GoloElement.cantConvert(String, Object)
